PropertyAttribute.Name: Comment
PropertyAttribute.Value: The basis for this rule set is the P"rogramming style guide for SIMATIC S7-1200/ S7-1500" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/de/view/81318674)

Rule.Name: NF002: Comment for Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Comment and property fields shall be used and filled with meaningful comments and information. Please refer to the programming style guide: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/81318674

Rule.Name: NF002: Comment for PLC data type

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Comment and property fields shall be used and filled with meaningful comments and information. Please refer to the programming style guide: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/81318674

Rule.Name: NF002: Comment for Global DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Comment and property fields shall be used and filled with meaningful comments and information. Please refer to the programming style guide: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/81318674

Rule.Name: NF002: Comment for Instance DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Comment and property fields shall be used and filled with meaningful comments and information. Please refer to the programming style guide: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/81318674

Rule.Name: NF002: Title for Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Comment and property fields shall be used and filled with meaningful comments and information. Please refer to the programming style guide: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/81318674

Rule.Name: NF002: Title for PLC data type

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Comment and property fields shall be used and filled with meaningful comments and information. Please refer to the programming style guide: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/81318674

Rule.Name: NF002: Title for Global DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Comment and property fields shall be used and filled with meaningful comments and information. Please refer to the programming style guide: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/81318674

Rule.Name: NF002: Title for Instance DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Comment and property fields shall be used and filled with meaningful comments and information. Please refer to the programming style guide: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/81318674

Rule.Name: NF002: Author for Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Comment and property fields shall be used and filled with meaningful comments and information. Please refer to the programming style guide: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/81318674

Rule.Name: NF002: Author for Global DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Comment and property fields shall be used and filled with meaningful comments and information. Please refer to the programming style guide: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/81318674

Rule.Name: NF004: Library prefix "L<Name>_" for Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The identifier of a library starts with the prefix L and is followed by a maximum of seven characters as the name (e.g. LGF). All types and master copies contained in the library get the identifier of the library.

Rule.Name: NF004: Library prefix "L<Name>_" for PLC data type

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The identifier of a library starts with the prefix L and is followed by a maximum of seven characters as the name (e.g. LGF). All types and master copies contained in the library get the identifier of the library.

Rule.Name: NF005: PascalCasing for Instance DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for Instance DBs are written using PascalCasing (e.g. InstConveyorFeed).

Rule.Name: NF005: PascalCasing for Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for Code block are written using PascalCasing (e.g. GetAxisData).

Rule.Name: NF005: PascalCasing for Global DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for Global DBs are written using PascalCasing (e.g. MachineParameter).

Rule.Name: NF005: PascalCasing for PLC tag table

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for PLC tag tables are written using PascalCasing (e.g. ConveyorProcess).

Rule.Name: NF006: camelCasing for PLC data type

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for PLC data types are written using camelCasing.

Rule.Name: NF006: camelCasing for Data type member

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for code elements are written using camelCasing.

Rule.Name: NF006: camelCasing for Global DB member

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for code elements are written using camelCasing.

Rule.Name: NF006: camelCasing for In, Out, InOut

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for parameters are written using camelCasing.

Rule.Name: NF006: camelCasing for Static

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for variables are written using camelCasing.

Rule.Name: NF006: camelCasing for PLC tag

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for PLC tags are written using camelCasing.

Rule.Name: NF006: camelCasing for Temp

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Identifiers for variables are written using camelCasing.

Rule.Name: NF007: No prefix for Constant

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: User constants do not get a prefix because UPPER_CASING already identifies them as constants.

Rule.Name: NF007: No prefix for PLC data type member

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The individual elements inside a PLC data type do not get a prefix.

Rule.Name: NF007: No prefix for Global DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Neither global DBs nor the contained elements get a prefix.

Rule.Name: NF007: No prefix for Global DB member

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Neither global DBs nor the contained elements get a prefix.

Rule.Name: NF007: No prefix for InOut

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Formal parameters of blocks are used without prefixes. Please note: The rule cannot detect parameter-instances, which carry a prefix "inst".

Rule.Name: NF007: No prefix for Input

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Formal parameters of blocks are used without prefixes.

Rule.Name: NF007: No prefix for Output

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Formal parameters of blocks are used without prefixes.

Rule.Name: NF007: No prefix for PLC tag table user constant

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: User constants do not get a prefix because UPPER_CASING already identifies them as constants.

Rule.Name: NF007: Prefix for PLC data type

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: A PLC data type gets the prefix “type” (e.g. typeDiagnostics). The individual elements inside the PLC data type do not get a prefix.

Rule.Name: NF007: Prefix for Instance DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Single instances DBs get the prefix “Inst” (e.g. InstConveyorFeed). With the prefixes in place it can be easier recognized, whether an (invalid) access to instance data has been made.

Rule.Name: NF007: Prefix for Static

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Static variables carry a prefix "stat" (e.g. statState) or in case of a multi-instances a prefix "inst" (e.g. instWatchdogTimer). Please note: The rule cannot detect multi-instances.

Rule.Name: NF007: Prefix for Temp

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Temporary variables carry the prefix "temp". This measure makes it easier for the programmer to distinguish between formal parameters and local data.

Rule.Name: NF008: UPPER_CASING for Constant

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The names for local constants are written completely with capital letters (UPPER_CASING). An underscore shall be used for seperation of words.

Rule.Name: NF008: UPPER_CASING for PLC Tag table user constant

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The names for global user constants are written completely with capital letters (UPPER_CASING). An underscore shall be used for seperation of words.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier Constant

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier PLC data type

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier PLC data type member

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier Global DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier Global DB member

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier In, Out, InOut

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier Instance DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier Static

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier PLC tag

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier PLC tag table

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier PLC tag table user constant

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: NF010: Maximum length identifier Temp

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The overall length of an identifier incl. prefix, suffix or library identifier shall not exceed 24 characters. Since variable names in structures are assembled out of many identifiers, the length of the identifier at the code location will become excessively long anyway.

Rule.Name: SE003/DA003: Automatic ENO for Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The use of the EN/ ENO mechanism avoids unexpected program interruptions. The block status is passed on in the format of a Boolean variable.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API accessability is set for PLC data type

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: In general, the accessibility via HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API must at least be activated in the editor for PLC data types to allow accesses. When using the PLC data type the access to it must be adjusted in the block interface accordingly.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API visibility is set for PLC data type

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: In general, the visibility via HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API must at least be activated in the editor for PLC data types to allow accesses. When using the PLC data type the access to it must be adjusted in the block interface accordingly.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API writability is set for PLC data type

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: In general, the writability via HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API must at least be activated in the editor for PLC data types to allow accesses. When using the PLC data type the access to it must be adjusted in the block interface accordingly.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API accessability is set for Static

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The access to static variables of a FB is not permitted. Formal paramters for read or write access must be created.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API visibility is set for Static

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The access to static variables of a FB is not permitted. Formal paramters for read or write access must be created.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API writability is set for Static

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: The access to static variables of a FB is not permitted. Formal paramters for read or write access must be created.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API accessability is set selectively for In, Out, InOut

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Per default the access to formal parameters per HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API shall be disabled. Enable it selectively.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API visibility is set selectively for In, Out, InOut

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Per default the access to formal parameters per HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API shall be disabled. Enable it selectively.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API writability is set selectively for In, Out, InOut

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Per default the access to formal parameters per HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API shall be disabled. Enable it selectively.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API accessability is set for Global DB member

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Per default the access to data block members per HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API shall be disabled. Enable it selectively.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API visibility is set for Global DB member

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Per default the access to data block members per HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API shall be disabled. Enable it selectively.

Rule.Name: SE004: HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API writability is set for Global DB member

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Per default the access to data block members per HMI/ OPC UA/ Web API shall be disabled. Enable it selectively.

Rule.Name: SE004: OPC UA accessability is set selectively for Global DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Per default the access to a data block via OPC UA shall be disabled. Enable it selectively.

Rule.Name: SE004: OPC UA accessability is set selectively for Instance DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Per default the access to a data block via OPC UA shall be disabled. Enable it selectively.

Rule.Name: DA003: Auto numbering Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Blocks (OB, FC, FB, DB, TO) shall only be delivered with auto numbering turned on. Be aware that the execution of an Organization blocks depends on its number/ priority.

Rule.Name: DA003: Auto numbering Global DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Blocks (OB, FC, FB, DB, TO) shall only be delivered with auto numbering turned on. Be aware that the execution of an Organization blocks depends on its number/ priority.

Rule.Name: DA003: Auto numbering Instance DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: Blocks (OB, FC, FB, DB, TO) shall only be delivered with auto numbering turned on. Be aware that the execution of an Organization blocks depends on its number/ priority.

Rule.Name: DA003: IEC check Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: To ensure the IEC conformant programming, the IEC check must be turned on. Only this way a type conformant and type safe programming can be ensured.

Rule.Name: DA003: Optimized access Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: For full symbolic programming and the maximum performance, the optimized access to blocks must be activated.

Rule.Name: DA003: Optimized access Global DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: For full symbolic programming and the maximum performance, the optimized access to blocks must be activated.

Rule.Name: DA003: Optimized access Instance DB

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: For full symbolic programming and the maximum performance, the optimized access to blocks must be activated.

Rule.Name: AL001/DA003: Multi-instance capability for Code block

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: In the program multi-instances shall be preferably used instead of single instances. With this method the creation of encapsulated modules in the form of a function block becomes possible. No additional instances in upper level structures or global structures become necessary, thus reducing the number of objects. (Refer to Rule AL001)

Rule.Name: PE005: Avoid formal parameter "mode"

RuleAttribute.Name: Comment
RuleAttribute.Value: This prevents code fragments that are not are needed (“dead code”), since the mode parameter is usually connected statically. Instead, you should distribute the functionalities to individual modules.
